CatDescriptText: John W. Greenfield, railroad company employee and father, 749 Bryn Mawr Rd., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "They would oppose it.  I'm certain of that.  In the first place, they have to pay so many taxes, like the school tax, and the Lawrence tax.  All the persons I have spoken to are opposed to any further tax increase."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John W. Greenfield wearing moustache, leather coat, eyeglasses, and hat with band, standing in front of wooden wall with metal hinge on left
